trans-unit.source: This topic describes the accessibility features of Windows PowerShell® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) that you might find helpful.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the accessibility features of Windows PowerShell® Integrated Scripting Environment (ISE) that you might find helpful.

trans-unit.source: [How to change the size and location of the Console and Script Panes](#bkmk_1)
trans-unit.target: [How to change the size and location of the Console and Script Panes](#bkmk_1)

trans-unit.source: Microsoft is committed to making its products and services easier for everyone to use.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft is committed to making its products and services easier for everyone to use.

trans-unit.source: The following topics provide information about the features, products, and services that make Windows PowerShell ISE more accessible for people with disabilities.
trans-unit.target: The following topics provide information about the features, products, and services that make Windows PowerShell ISE more accessible for people with disabilities.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell ISE supports high contrast mode.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell ISE supports high contrast mode.

trans-unit.source: For the visually impaired, breakpoint information is available through the cmdlets for managing breakpoints, such as [Get-PSBreakpoint](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/0bf48936-00ab-411c-b5e0-9b10a812a3c6) and [Set-PSBreakpoint](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/6afd5d2c-a285-4796-8607-3cbf49471420).
trans-unit.target: For the visually impaired, breakpoint information is available through the cmdlets for managing breakpoints, such as [Get-PSBreakpoint](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/0bf48936-00ab-411c-b5e0-9b10a812a3c6) and [Set-PSBreakpoint](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/6afd5d2c-a285-4796-8607-3cbf49471420).

trans-unit.source: For more information please see “How to manage breakpoints” in [How to Debug Scripts in the Windows PowerShell ISE](../core-powershell/ise/How-to-Debug-Scripts-in-Windows-PowerShell-ISE.md#bkmk_1).
trans-unit.target: For more information please see “How to manage breakpoints” in [How to Debug Scripts in the Windows PowerShell ISE](../core-powershell/ise/How-to-Debug-Scripts-in-Windows-PowerShell-ISE.md#bkmk_1).

trans-unit.source: In addition to accessibility features and utilities in Microsoft Windows, the following features make Windows PowerShell ISE more accessible for people with disabilities:
trans-unit.target: In addition to accessibility features and utilities in Microsoft Windows, the following features make Windows PowerShell ISE more accessible for people with disabilities:

trans-unit.source: Syntax Coloring Table and the ability to modify several other color settings using the [$psISE.Options](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/75e2a76f-f3d1-490b-ad5d-e3829946aabb) scripting object.
trans-unit.target: Syntax Coloring Table and the ability to modify several other color settings using the [$psISE.Options](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/75e2a76f-f3d1-490b-ad5d-e3829946aabb) scripting object.

trans-unit.source: How to change the size and location of the Console and Script Panes
trans-unit.target: How to change the size and location of the Console and Script Panes

trans-unit.source: You can use the following steps to change the size and location of the Console Pane and the Script Pane.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following steps to change the size and location of the Console Pane and the Script Pane.

trans-unit.source: When you open the Windows PowerShell ISE again, the size and location changes you made will be retained.
trans-unit.target: When you open the Windows PowerShell ISE again, the size and location changes you made will be retained.

trans-unit.source: To resize the Script Pane and Console Pane
trans-unit.target: To resize the Script Pane and Console Pane

trans-unit.source: Pause the pointer on the split line between the Script Pane and Console Pane.
trans-unit.target: Pause the pointer on the split line between the Script Pane and Console Pane.

trans-unit.source: When the mouse pointer changes to a two-headed arrow, drag the border to change the size of the pane.
trans-unit.target: When the mouse pointer changes to a two-headed arrow, drag the border to change the size of the pane.

trans-unit.source: To move the Script Pane and Console Pane
trans-unit.target: To move the Script Pane and Console Pane

trans-unit.source: To move the Script Pane above the Console Pane, press **CTRL+1** or, on the toolbar, click the **Show Script Pane Top** icon, or in the **View** menu, click **Show Script Pane Top**.
trans-unit.target: To move the Script Pane above the Console Pane, press **CTRL+1** or, on the toolbar, click the **Show Script Pane Top** icon, or in the **View** menu, click **Show Script Pane Top**.

trans-unit.source: To move the Script Pane to the right of the Console Pane, press **CTRL+2** or, on the toolbar, click the **Show Script Pane Right** icon, or in the **View** menu, click **Show Script Pane Right**.
trans-unit.target: To move the Script Pane to the right of the Console Pane, press **CTRL+2** or, on the toolbar, click the **Show Script Pane Right** icon, or in the **View** menu, click **Show Script Pane Right**.

trans-unit.source: To maximize the Script Pane, press **CTRL+3** or, on the toolbar, click the **Show Script Pane Maximized** icon, or in the **View** menu, click **Show Script Pane Maximized**.
trans-unit.target: To maximize the Script Pane, press **CTRL+3** or, on the toolbar, click the **Show Script Pane Maximized** icon, or in the **View** menu, click **Show Script Pane Maximized**.

trans-unit.source: To maximize the Console Pane and hide the Script Pane, on the far right edge of the row of tabs, click the **Hide Script Pane** icon, in the **View** menu, click to deselect the **Show Script Pane** menu option.
trans-unit.target: To maximize the Console Pane and hide the Script Pane, on the far right edge of the row of tabs, click the **Hide Script Pane** icon, in the **View** menu, click to deselect the **Show Script Pane** menu option.

trans-unit.source: To display the Script Pane when the Console Pane is maximized, on the far right edge of the row of tabs, click the **Show Script Pane** icon, or in the **View** menu, click to select the **Show Script Pane** menu option.
trans-unit.target: To display the Script Pane when the Console Pane is maximized, on the far right edge of the row of tabs, click the **Show Script Pane** icon, or in the **View** menu, click to select the **Show Script Pane** menu option.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts when you edit text.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts when you edit text.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts when you run scripts in the Script Pane.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts when you run scripts in the Script Pane.

trans-unit.source: CTRL+C can be used when the context is unambiguous (when there is no text selected).
trans-unit.target: CTRL+C can be used when the context is unambiguous (when there is no text selected).

trans-unit.source: CTRL+TAB **Note:** Tab to next script works only when you have a single PowerShell tab open, or when you have more than one PowerShell tab open, but the focus is in the Script Pane.
trans-unit.target: CTRL+TAB **Note:** Tab to next script works only when you have a single PowerShell tab open, or when you have more than one PowerShell tab open, but the focus is in the Script Pane.

trans-unit.source: CTRL+SHIFT+TAB **Note:** Tab to previous script works when you have only one PowerShell tab open, or if you have more than one PowerShell tab open, and the focus is in the Script Pane.
trans-unit.target: CTRL+SHIFT+TAB **Note:** Tab to previous script works when you have only one PowerShell tab open, or if you have more than one PowerShell tab open, and the focus is in the Script Pane.

trans-unit.source: Keyboard shortcuts for customizing the view
trans-unit.target: Keyboard shortcuts for customizing the view

trans-unit.source: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts to customize the view in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts to customize the view in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: They are accessible from all the panes in the application.
trans-unit.target: They are accessible from all the panes in the application.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the keyboard shortcuts designed for the Windows PowerShell console when you debug scripts in Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the keyboard shortcuts designed for the Windows PowerShell console when you debug scripts in Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: To use these shortcuts, you must type the shortcut in the Console Pane and press ENTER.
trans-unit.target: To use these shortcuts, you must type the shortcut in the Console Pane and press ENTER.

trans-unit.source: Keyboard shortcuts for Windows PowerShell tabs
trans-unit.target: Keyboard shortcuts for Windows PowerShell tabs

trans-unit.target: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts when you use Windows PowerShell tabs.

trans-unit.source: This shortcut works only when no files are open on any PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: This shortcut works only when no files are open on any PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: Keyboard shortcuts for starting and exiting
trans-unit.target: Keyboard shortcuts for starting and exiting

trans-unit.source: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts to start the Windows PowerShell console (PowerShell.exe) or to exit Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following keyboard shortcuts to start the Windows PowerShell console (PowerShell.exe) or to exit Windows PowerShell ISE.
